A002638.name: a(n) = (number of nonisomorphic nontransitive prime tournaments on n nodes) - Moebius(n).
formula: a(n) = A259106(n) - A008683(n). - _Pontus von Brömssen_, Oct 03 2020

A002639.name: Numerators of expansion of Jacobi nome q in parameter m.

A002640.name: Numbers n such that (n^2 + n + 1)/3 is prime.

A002641.name: Numbers n such that (n^2 + n + 1)/7 is prime.

A002642.name: Numbers n such that (n^2 + n + 1)/13 is prime.

A002643.name: Numbers n such that (n^2 + n + 1)/19 is prime.

A002644.name: Numbers n such that (n^2 + n + 1)/21 is prime.

A002645.name: Quartan primes: primes of the form x^4 + y^4, x>0, y>0.
formula: A000040 INTERSECTION A003336. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Sep 23 2006

A002646.name: Half-quartan primes: primes of the form p = (x^4 + y^4)/2.

A002648.name: A variant of the cuban primes: primes p = (x^3 - y^3 )/(x - y) where x = y + 2.

A002651.name: Dates at 16-day intervals starting at the beginning of a leap year.

A002652.name: Theta series of Kleinian lattice Z[(1 + sqrt(-7))/ 2] in 1 complex (or 2 real) dimensions.
formula: G.f.: 1 + 2 * Sum_{k>0} Kronecker(-7, k) * x^k / (1 - x^k). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 17 2012

Expansion of phi(x) * phi(x^7) + 4 * x^2 * psi(x^2) * psi(x^14) = phi(-x) * phi(-x^7) + 4 * x * psi(x) * psi(x^7) in powers of x where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 17 2012
Expansion of ((eta(q) * eta(q^7))^3 + 4 * (eta(q^2) * eta(q^14))^3) / (eta(q) * eta(q^2) * eta(q^7) * eta(q^14)) in powers of q. - _Michael Somos_, May 28 2005
Moebius transform is period 7 sequence [ 2, 2, -2, 2, -2, -2, 0, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Oct 07 2005
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2), A(x^4)) where f(u, v, w) = u^2 + 5 * v^2 + 4 * w^2 + 2 * u*w - 4 * u*v - 8 * v*w. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 20 2004
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (7 t)) = 7^(1/2) (t/i) f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 17 2012

a(0) = 1, a(n) = 2 * b(n) for n > 0, where b() is multiplicative with b(7^e) = 1, b(p^e) = e + 1 if p == 1, 2, 4 (mod 7), b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if p == 3, 5, 6 (mod 7). - _Michael Somos_, Jun 10 2015

A002653.name: Expansion of (theta_3(z)*theta_3(7z)+theta_2(z)*theta_2(7z))^3.
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2), A(x^4)) where f(u, v, w) is a homogeneous degree 6 polynomial with 28 terms. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 03 2005
Expansion of (eta(q)^8 + 13 * eta(q)^4 * eta(q^7)^4 + 49 * eta(q^7)^8) / ( eta(q) * eta(q^7) ) in power of q. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 11 2008
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (7*t)) = 7^(3/2)*(t/i)^3*f(t) where q = exp(2*Pi*i*t).

A002654.name: Number of ways of writing n as a sum of at most two nonzero squares, where order matters; also (number of divisors of n of form 4m+1) - (number of divisors of form 4m+3).
formula: Dirichlet series: (1-2^(-s))^(-1)*Product (1-p^(-s))^(-2) (p=1 mod 4) * Product (1-p^(-2s))^(-1) (p=3 mod 4) = Dedekind zeta-function of Z[ i ].
Coefficients in expansion of Dirichlet series Product_p (1-(Kronecker(m, p)+1)*p^(-s)+Kronecker(m, p)*p^(-2s))^(-1) for m = -16.
If n=2^k*u*v, where u is product of primes 4m+1, v is product of primes 4m+3, then a(n)=0 unless v is a square, in which case a(n) = number of divisors of u (Jacobi).
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = 1 if p = 2; e+1 if p == 1 (mod 4); (e+1) mod 2 if p == 3 (mod 4). - _David W. Wilson_, Sep 01 2001
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2), A(x^4)) where f(u, v, w) = (u - v)^2 - (v - w) * (4*w + 1). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 19 2004
Expansion of (eta(q^2)^10 / (eta(q) * eta(q^4))^4 - 1)/4 in powers of q.
a(n) = sum(A056594(d-1), d divides n), n >= 1. See the above comment on A056594(d-1) = h(d) of the Niven-Zuckerman reference. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Apr 19 2013
Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s)*beta(s) = zeta(s)*L(chi_2(4),s). - _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 27 2015
G.f.: (theta_3(x)^2 - 1)/4, where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 17 2018
a(n) = Sum_{ m: m^2|n } A000089(n/m^2). - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, May 07 2018

A002655.name: Expansion of Product_{i >= 1} (1-q^i)(1-q^{7i}).
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/3) * eta(q) * eta(q^7) in powers of q.
Euler transform of period 7 sequence [ -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, -2, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Dec 06 2004
Given g.f. A(x), B(q) = q * A(q^3) satisfies 0 = f(B(q), B(q^2), B(q^4)) where f(u, v, w) = u^2*w + 2 * u*w^2 - v^3 - _Michael Somos_, Dec 06 2004

a(n) = b(3*n + 1) where b(n) is multiplicative and b(p^(2*e)) = (-1)^e if p=2, b(p^e) = 0^e if p = 3, b(p^e) = (-1)^e if p = 7, b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if p == 3, 5, 6 (mod 7), else p == 1, 2, 4 (mod 7) and p = y^2 + 7*x^2 when b(p^(2*e)) = (-1)^e if x*y not divisible by 3, b(p^e) = e+1 if x divisible by 3 or (e+1) * (-1)^e if y divisible by 3 . - _Michael Somos_, May 28 2005
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (63 t)) =  63^(1/2) (t/i) f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t). - _Michael Somos_, May 17 2015

A002656.name: Expansion of (eta(q) * eta(q^7))^3 in powers of q.
formula: Euler transform of period 7 sequence [ -3, -3, -3, -3, -3, -3, -6, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 11 2004

a(n) is multiplicative with a(7^e) = (-7)^e, a(p^e) = p^e * (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if p == 3, 5, 6 (mod 7), a(p^e) = a(p) * a(p^(e-1)) - p^2 * a(p^(e-2)) and a(2) = -3, a(p) = 2 * (x^2 - 7*y^2) where p = x^2 + 7*y^2 if p == 1, 2, 4 (mod 7). - _Michael Somos_, Apr 12 2008.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2), A(x^4)) where f(u, v, w) = u * w * (u + 6*v + 8*w) - v^3. - _Michael Somos_, May 02 2005.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (7 t)) = 7^(3/2) (t/i)^3 f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t). - _Michael Somos_, Apr 12 2008
G.f.: (1/2) * Sum_{u,v in Z} (u*u - 2*v*v) * x^(u*u + u*v + 2*v*v). - _Michael Somos_, Jun 14 2007

A002657.name: Numerators of Cauchy numbers of second type (= Bernoulli numbers B_n^{(n)}).
formula: Numerator of integral of x(x+1)...(x+n-1) from 0 to 1.
E.g.f.: -x/((1-x)*log(1-x)). (Note: the numerator of the coefficient of x^n/n! is a(n). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 12 2014). E.g.f. rewritten by _Iaroslav V. Blagouchine_, May 07 2016
Numerator of Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^(n-k) A008275(n,k)/(k+1). - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 28 2009
a(n) = numerator(n!*v(n)), where v(n) = 1 - Sum_{i=0..n-1} v(i)/(n-i+1), v(0)=1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 28 2013

A002658.name: a(0) = a(1) = 1; for n > 0, a(n+1) = a(n)*(a(0) + ... + a(n-1)) + a(n)*(a(n) + 1)/2.
formula: a(n + 1) = a(n) * (a(n) / a(n-1) + (a(n) + a(n-1)) / 2) [equation (5) on page 87 of Melzak 1968 with a() instead of his f()].

A002659.name: a(n) = 2*sigma(n) - 1.
formula: G.f. for Moebius transf.: (x + 2x^2 - x^3 ) / (1 - x )^2.

A002660.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n, d <= 3} d^2 + 3*Sum_{d|n, d>3} d.
formula: Conjectured: Inverse Moebius transform of g.f.: (x + 2x^2 + 2x^3 - 2x^4) / (1 - x)^2. - _Sean A. Irvine_, May 16 2014
a(n) = 3 * sigma(n) - k, where k = 4 if n is even and k = 2 if n is odd. - _Sean A. Irvine_, May 16 2014

A002661.name: Least integer having Radon random number n.
formula: a(n) = ceiling(binomial(n + 1, floor((n + 1) / 2)) / 2). - _Sean A. Irvine_, May 21 2014; corrected by _Matthew House_, Jul 29 2015

A002662.name: a(n) = 2^n - 1 - n*(n+1)/2.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n,k+3) = Sum_{k=3..n} binomial(n,k). - _Paul Barry_, Jul 30 2004
(1, 5, 16, 42, 99, ...) = binomial transform of (1, 4, 7, 8, 8, 8, ...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 30 2007
a(n) = n - 2 + 3*a(n-1) - 2*a(n-2), for n >= 2. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Jul 11 2013
Convolution of A001045 and (A000290 shifted by one place). - _Oboifeng Dira_,  Aug 16 2016
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n-2} Sum_{i=1..n} (n-k-1) * C(k,i). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 19 2017

A002663.name: a(n) = 2^n - C(n,0) - C(n,1) - C(n,2) - C(n,3).
formula: G.f.: x^4/((1-2*x)*(1-x)^4). - _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n,k+4) = Sum_{k=4..n} binomial(n,k). - _Paul Barry_, Aug 23 2004
a(n) = (6*2^n - n^3 - 5*n - 6)/6. - _Mats Granvik_, _Gary W. Adamson_, Feb 17 2010

A002664.name: a(n) = 2^n - C(n,0)- ... - C(n,4).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} C(n, k+5) = Sum_{k=5..n} C(n, k); a(n) = 2a(n-1) + C(n-1, 4). - _Paul Barry_, Aug 23 2004

a(n) = 2^n - n^4/24 + n^3/12 - 11*n^2/24 - 7*n/12 - 1.  - _Bruno Berselli_, May 19 2011 [Robinson (1985) gives an alternative version of this formula, for a different offset. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 20 2015]

A002665.name: Continued fraction expansion of Lehmer's constant.

A002666.name: Continued cotangent for square root of 2.

A002669.name: Numerator of constant term in polynomial arising from numerical integration formula.

A002670.name: Denominator of constant term in polynomial arising from numerical integration formula.

A002671.name: a(n) = 4^n*(2*n+1)!.
formula: a(n) = 16^n * Pochhammer(1,n) * Pochhammer(3/2,n). - _Roger L. Bagula_, Apr 26 2013

A002672.name: Denominators of central difference coefficients M_{3}^(2n+1).
formula: a(n) = denominator(3! * m(3, 2 * n + 1) / (2 * n + 1)!) where m(k, k) = 1; m(k, q) = 0 for k = 0, k > q, or k + q odd; m(1, q) = 1/2^(q-1) for odd q; m(2, q) = 1 for even q; m(k, q+2) = m(k-2, q) + (k/2)^2 * m(k, q) otherwise. [From Salzer] - _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 20 2016

A002673.name: Numerators of central difference coefficients M_{3}^(2n+1).

A002674.name: a(n) = (2n)!/2.
formula: Series reversion ( Sum_{n >= 1} x^n/a(n) ) = Sum_{n >= 1} (-1)^n*x^n/b(n-1), where b(n) = A002544(n). - _Peter Bala_, Apr 18 2017

A002675.name: Numerators of coefficients for central differences M_{4}^(2*n).

A002676.name: Denominators of coefficients for central differences M_{4}^(2*n).
formula: a(n) = denominator(4! * m(4, 2 * n) / (2 * n)!) where m(k, q) is defined in A002672. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 20 2016

A002677.name: Denominators of coefficients for central differences M_{3}'^(2*n+1).
formula: a(n) are the denominators in the expansion of (1/2)*(d/dx)(2*sinh(sqrt(x)/2))^4 =

The a(n) also appear as denominators in the difference formula: (1/2)*f(x+2) - f(x+1) + f(x-1) - (1/2)*f(x-2) = D^3(f(x)) + (1/4)*D^5(f(x)) + (1/40)*D^7(f(x)) + (17/12096)*D^9(f(x)) + ..., where D denotes the differential operator d/dx.

A002678.name: Numerators of the Taylor coefficients of (e^x-1)^2.
formula: a(n) is the numerator of (2^n-2)/n! with generating function (e^x-1)^2. - _David Broadhurst_, Jan 19 2006

A002680.name: Denominators of coefficients of polynomials arising from Chebyshev quadrature.

A002681.name: Numerators of coefficients for repeated integration.
formula: a(n) is the numerator of ((n+1)/2)M(n) + (2n+2)M(n+1), where M(n) = (2/(2n+1)!)*Integral_{t=0..1} (t*Product_{k=1..n} (t^2 - k^2)). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 25 2005

A002682.name: Denominators of coefficients for repeated integration.
formula: a(n) is the denominator of ((n+1)/2)M(n) + (2n+2)M(n+1), where M(n) = (2/(2n+1)!)*Integral_{t=0..1} (t*Product_{k=1..n} (t^2 - k^2)). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 25 2005

A002683.name: Numerators of coefficients for repeated integration.
formula: a(n) is the numerator of -(n/2)M(n)-(2n+2)M(n+1), where M(n)=(2/(2n+1)!)*int(t*product(t^2-k^2, k=1..n), t=0..1). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 25 2005

A002684.name: Denominators of coefficients for repeated integration.
formula: a(n) is the denominator of -(n/2)M(n)-(2n+2)M(n+1), where M(n)=(2/(2n+1)!)*int(t*product(t^2-k^2, k=1..n), t=0..1). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 25 2005

A002687.name: Numerators of coefficients for repeated integration.

A002688.name: Denominators of coefficients for repeated integration.

A002689.name: Denominators of coefficients for repeated integration.

A002694.name: Binomial coefficients C(2n, n-2).
formula: a(n) = A067310(n, 1) as this is number of ways of arranging n chords on a circle (handshakes between 2n people across a table) with exactly 1 simple intersection. - _Henry Bottomley_, Oct 07 2002
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} C(n, k)*C(n, k+2). - _Paul Barry_, Sep 20 2004
D-finite with recurrence: -(n-2)*(n+2)*a(n) + 2*n*(2*n-1)*a(n-1) = 0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 04 2012
G.f.: z^2*C(z)^4/(1-2*z*C(z)), where C(z) is the g.f. of Catalan numbers. - _José Luis Ramírez Ramírez_, Apr 19 2015

A002695.name: P_n'(3), where P_n is n-th Legendre polynomial.
formula: a(n) = (n+1) * n * A001003(n)/2, n>0. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Mar 29 2013

A002696.name: Binomial coefficients C(2n,n-3).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} C(n, k)*C(n, k+3). - _Hermann Stamm-Wilbrandt_, Aug 17 2015
E.g.f.: I_3(2*x)*exp(2*x) where I_3 is a modified Bessel function. (End)

A002697.name: a(n) = n*4^(n-1).
formula: G.f.: x/(1-4x)^2. a(n+1) is the convolution of powers of 4 (A000302). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, May 16 2003
Third binomial transform of n. E.g.f.: x*exp(4x). - _Paul Barry_, Jul 22 2003
For n>=0, a(n+1) = Sum_{i+j+k+l=n} binomial(2i, i)*binomial(2j, j)*binomial(2k, k)*binomial(2l, l). - _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 22 2004
a(n+1) is the convolution of A000984 with A002457. - _Rui Duarte_, Oct 08 2011
G.f.: W(0)*x/2 , where W(k) = 1 + 1/( 1 - 4*x*(k+2)/( 4*x*(k+2) + (k+1)/W(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 19 2013

A002699.name: a(n) = n*2^(2*n-1).
formula: a(n) = 8*a(n-1)-16*a(n-2) with n>1, a(0)=0, a(1)=2. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 20 2013

A002700.name: Coefficients of Chebyshev polynomials: n*(2*n+1) * 4^(n-1).
formula: a(n) = 1/2*Sum_{k = 0..2*n} k^2*binomial(2*n,k). Cf. A002699. - _Peter Bala_, Apr 09 2017

A002704.name: Number of sets with a congruence property.

A002706.name: Theta series of 6-dimensional lattice A_6^(2) (other names for this lattice or the corresponding quadratic form are LAMBDA_{3,lambda}, P_6^(5), phi_6, F_14).
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2), A(x^4)) where f(u, v, w) is a homogeneous degree 6 polynomial with 28 terms. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 03 2005

A002707.name: Number of ternary trees with n nodes.

A002712.name: Number of unrooted triangulations of a disk that have reflection symmetry with n interior nodes and 3 nodes on the boundary.

A002713.name: Number of unrooted triangulations of the disk with n interior nodes and 3 nodes on the boundary.

A002714.name: Number of different keys with n cuts, depths between 1 and 7 and depth difference at most 1 between adjacent cut depths.
formula: G.f.: (2*x^4 - 5*x^3 - 7*x^2 + 3*x + 1)/(-x^4 + 4*x^3 + 2*x^2 - 4*x + 1); (from the Knopfmacher et al. reference). - _Joerg Arndt_, Aug 10 2012

A002715.name: An infinite coprime sequence defined by recursion.

A002716.name: An infinite coprime sequence defined by recursion.

A002717.name: a(n) = floor(n(n+2)(2n+1)/8).
formula: G.f.: x(1+2x)/((1+x)(1-x)^4). - _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation (with a different offset).
a(n) = a(n-1) + A016777(floor(0.5n)*floor(0.5+0.5n). - _Arlu Genesis A. Padilla_, Jun 04 2014
a(n)= Sum_{i=1..n} T(n-i+1)+T(n-2*i+1), where T(n)=n*(n+1)/2=A000217(n) if n>0 and 0 if n<=0. So we have a(n+2)-a(n)=(n+2)^2+(n+1)*(n+2)/2. - _Maurice Mischler_, Sep 08 2014

A002718.name: Number of bicoverings of an n-set.
formula: E.g.f. for k-block bicoverings of an n-set is exp(-x-1/2*x^2*(exp(y)-1))*Sum_{i=0..inf} x^i/i!*exp(binomial(i, 2)*y).
The e.g.f.'s of A002718 (T(x)) and A060053 (V(x)) are related by T(x) = V(e^x-1).

a(n) = Sum_{m=0..n + floor(n/2); k=0..n; s=0..min(m/2,k); t=0..m-2s} Stirling2(n,k) * k!/m! * binomial(m,2s) * A001147(s) * (-1)^(m+s+t) * binomial(m-2s,t) * binomial(t*(t-1)/2,k-s). Interpret m as the number of blocks in a bicovering, k the number of clumps of points that are always all together in blocks. This formula counts bicoverings by quotienting them to the clumpless case (an operation which preserves degree) and counting incidence matrices of those, and counts those matrices as the transposes of incidence matrices of labeled graphs with no isolated points and no isolated edges. - _David Pasino_, Jul 09 2016

A002720.name: Number of partial permutations of an n-set; number of n X n binary matrices with at most one 1 in each row and column.
formula: a(n) = sum(k>=0, (k+n)! / ((k!)^2*exp(1)) ). - _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 02 2002 [corrected by _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 28 2012]
a(n) = sum{k=0..n, C(n, k)n!/k!}. - _Paul Barry_, May 07 2004
a(n) = Sum(P(n, k)C(n, k) {k=0...n}); a(n) = Sum(n!^2 / k!(n-k)!^2 {k=0...n}). - _Ross La Haye_, Sep 20 2004
Define b(n) by b(0) = 1, b(n) = b(n-1) + 1/n * Sum_{0<=k<n} b(k). Then b(n) = a(n)/n!. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 05 2005

Asymptotically, a(n)/n! ~ (1/2)*Pi^(-1/2)*exp(-1/2+2*n^(1/2))/n^(1/4) and so a(n) ~ C*BesselI(0, 2*sqrt(n))*n! with C = exp(-1/2) = 0.6065306597126334236... - Alec Mihailovs, Sep 06 2005, establishing a conjecture of _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_
a(n) = sum {k=0..inf}[binomial(n+k,n)/k!] * n! / exp(1). - _Gottfried Helms_, Nov 25 2006

Integral representation as n-th moment of a positive function on a positive halfaxis (solution of the Stieltjes moment problem), in Maple notation: a(n) = int(x^n*BesselI(0,2*sqrt(x))*exp(-x)/exp(1), x=0..infinity), n=0,1... . - _Karol A. Penson_ and G. H. E. Duchamp (gduchamp2(AT)free.fr), Jan 09 2007
E.g.f.: exp(x) * Sum_{n>=0} x^n/n!^2 = Sum_{n>=0} a(n)*x^n/n!^2. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 18 2011
Denominators in the sequence of convergents coming from Stieltjes' continued fraction for A073003, the Euler-Gompertz constant G := int {x = 0..inf} 1/(1+x)*exp(-x) dx:

G = 1/(2 - 1^2/(4 - 2^2/(6 - 3^2/(8 - ...)))). See [Wall, Chapter 18, (92.7) with a = 1]. The sequence of convergents to the continued fraction begins [1/2, 4/7, 20/34, 124/209, ...]. The numerators are in A002793. (End)

E.g.f.: exp(x/(1-x))/(1-x) = G(0)/(1-x) where  G(k) = 1 + x/((2*k+1)*(1-x) - x*(1-x)*(2*k+1)/(x + (1-x)*(2*k+2)/G(k+1) )); (recursively defined continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 28 2012
a(n) = sum(k=0..n, L(n,k)*(k+1)); L(n,k) the unsigned Lah numbers. - _Peter Luschny_, Oct 18 2014

A002721.name: Number of 3 X 3 X 3 arrays M_ijk (1 <= i,j,k <= 3) with entries satisfying 0 <= M_ijk <= n and all line sums equal to n.
formula: a(n) = (1/4032) * m * (m * (m * (31 * m + 1004) + 6820) + 4272) + 1, where m = n*(n+1) (from the Bell reference). -  _Sean A. Irvine_, Jul 01 2014

A002724.name: Number of inequivalent n X n binary matrices, where equivalence means permutations of rows or columns.

A002725.name: Number of incidence matrices: n X (n+1) binary matrices under row and column permutations.

A002727.name: Number of 3 X n binary matrices up to row and column permutations.
formula: a(n) = -a(-8 - n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 22 2016

A002728.name: Number of n X (n+2) binary matrices.

A002729.name: Number of equivalence classes of binary sequences of period n.

A002730.name: Number of equivalence classes of binary sequences of primitive period n.

A002731.name: Numbers n such that (n^2 + 1)/2 is prime.

A002732.name: Numbers n such that (4n^2 + 1)/5 is prime.

A002733.name: Numbers k such that (k^2 + 1)/10 is prime.
formula: a(n) = sqrt(10*A207337(n)-1) = sqrt(8*A207339(n)+1), n >= 1. - Wolfdieter Lang, Feb 27 2012

A002736.name: Apéry numbers: a(n) = n^2*C(2n,n).
formula: G.f.: x*(4*x+2)/((1-4*x)^(5/2)). - _Marco A. Cisneros Guevara_, Jul 25 2011
Sum_{n>=1} (-1)^(n+1)/a(n) = 2*log(phi)^2 = A086467, where phi is the golden ratio. (End)
D-finite with recurrence: (-n+1)*a(n) +2*(n+4)*a(n-1) +4*(2*n-3)*a(n-2)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 21 2020

A002737.name: a(n) = Sum_{j=0..n} (n+j)*binomial(n+j,j).
formula: These conjectures are correct - see A331432. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 17 2020

A002738.name: Coefficients for extrapolation.
formula: a(n) = binomial(2*n+3,n)*(n^3 + 6*n^2 + 11*n+6)/2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 02 2011

A002740.name: Number of tree-rooted bridgeless planar maps with two vertices and n faces.
formula: a(n+2) = Sum_{k=0..n} k*binomial(k+n, k). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 25 2003
a(n) = Sum_{k=2..n} Sum_{j=1..n} binomial(2*n,n)/(2*(n+1)), n >= 0. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 09 2007

A002741.name: Logarithmic numbers: expansion of -log(1-x) e^(-x).
formula: a(n) = n-th forward difference of [0, 1, 1, 2, 6, 24, ...] (factorials A000142 with 0 prepended). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 28 2011

A002742.name: Logarithmic numbers.
formula: E.g.f.: A(x) = - D(exp(-x)*log(1-x^2)), where D is the derivative with respect to x. (End)

A002743.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: E.g.f.: exp(-x) * Sum_{k>=1} x^k / (k*(1 - x^k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Dec 11 2019
a(p) == -1 (mod p) for prime p. The pseudoprimes of this congruence are 6, 42, 1806, ... - _Amiram Eldar_, May 13 2020

A002744.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: a(p) == -2 (mod p) for prime p. The pseudoprimes of this congruence are 4, 6, 20, 42, 1806, ... - _Amiram Eldar_, May 13 2020

A002745.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} A000203(k)*(k-1)!*binomial(n, k). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 09 2003
E.g.f.: exp(x) * Sum_{k>=1} x^k / (k*(1 - x^k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Dec 11 2019
a(p) == -1 (mod p) for prime p. The pseudoprimes of this congruence are 30, 858, 1722, ... - _Amiram Eldar_, May 13 2020

A002746.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} A000005(k)*(k-1)!*binomial(n, k). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 09 2003
a(p) == -2 (mod p) for prime p. The pseudoprimes of this congruence are 4, 12, 30, 380, 858, 1722 ... - _Amiram Eldar_, May 13 2020

A002747.name: Logarithmic numbers.
formula: For n odd, n! * Sum_{i=0..n-1 i even} 1/i!, for n even, n! * Sum_{i=1..n-1, i odd} 1/i!. - _Gerald McGarvey_, Jun 06 2004

A002748.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: E.g.f.: F(x)/exp(x)/x where F(x) is o.g.f. for A000203(). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 09 2003

A002749.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: E.g.f.: F(x)/exp(x)/x where F(x) is o.g.f. for A000005(). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 09 2003

A002750.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: E.g.f.: F(x)/x*exp(x) where F(x) is o.g.f. for A000203(). a(n) = Sum _{m=1..n+1} A000203(m)*binomial(n, m-1)*(m-1)!. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 08 2003

A002751.name: Sum of logarithmic numbers.
formula: E.g.f.: F(x)/x*exp(x) where F(x) is o.g.f. for A000005(). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 09 2003

A002754.name: Related to coefficient of m in Jacobi elliptic function cn(z, m).

A002755.name: Number of bipartite partitions of n white objects and 6 black ones.
formula: a(n) ~ sqrt(3) * n^2 * exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n/3)) / (40*Pi^6). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 01 2016

A002756.name: Number of bipartite partitions of n white objects and 7 black ones.

A002757.name: Number of bipartite partitions of n white objects and 8 black ones.

A002758.name: Number of bipartite partitions of n white objects and 9 black ones.

A002759.name: Number of bipartite partitions of n white objects and 10 black ones.
formula: a(n) ~ sqrt(3) * n^4 * exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n/3)) / (5600*Pi^10). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 01 2016

A002760.name: Squares and cubes.
formula: Sum_{n>=2} 1/a(n) = zeta(2) + zeta(3) - zeta(6). - _Amiram Eldar_, Dec 19 2020

A002761.name: Number of ways of getting a royal flush, other straight flush, 4 of a kind, full house, other flush, other straight, 3 of a kind, 2 pair, a pair or nothing in 5-card poker.

A002769.name: Discriminants of totally real quartic fields.

A002770.name: Integers connected with coefficients in expansion of Weierstrass P-function.
formula: a(n) = A002306(n) / A047817(n) - 1/2 - sum(chi(p)^(4*n / (p-1))/p) where the sum is over primes p of the form 4k+1 such that p-1 divides 4*n and the numbers chi(p) are given by A002172. The resulting a(n) is an integer despite all the rationals. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 17 2014

A002771.name: Number of terms in a skew determinant: a(n) = (A000085(n) + A081919(n))/2.
formula: a(n) = sum(binomial(n, 2*k) * (2*k-1)!! * (1 + (2*k-1)!!) / 2, k=0..floor(n/2)). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 18 2014

A002772.name: Number of terms in a bordered skew determinant.
formula: a(n) = (n-1)! * sum(A002771(k) / k!, k=0..n-1) with the understanding that A002771(0) = 1. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 18 2014

A002773.name: Number of nonisomorphic simple matroids (or geometries) with n points.
formula: 2^n/n^(3/2) << log a(n) << 2^n/n, proved by Knuth and Piff respectively. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 20 2021
Bansal, Pendavingh, & van der Pol prove an upper bound almost matching the lower bound above: log a(n) <= 2*sqrt(2/Pi)*2^n/n^(3/2)*(1 + o(1)). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 20 2021

A002774.name: Number of bipartite partitions of n white objects and n black ones.
formula: Formula (25) in the article by Auluck is incorrect. The correct formula is: p(n,n) ~ c^(19/12) * exp(3*c*n^(2/3) + 3*d*n^(1/3) + Zeta'(-1) - 3*d^2/(4*c)) / (sqrt(3) * (2*Pi)^(3/2) * n^(55/36)), where c = Zeta(3)^(1/3), d = Zeta(2)/(3*c). Also formula (24) is incorrect. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 30 2016

where m and n are of the same order, c = Zeta(3)^(1/3), d = Zeta(2)/(3*c) and fi(alfa) = Integral_{t=0..infinity} 1/t*(1/(exp(alfa*t)-1)/(exp(t/alfa)-1) - alfa/t/(exp(alfa*t)-1) - 1/alfa/t/(exp(t/alfa)-1) + 1/t^2 + 1/4/(exp(alfa*t)-1) + 1/4/(exp(t/alfa)-1) - alfa/4/t - 1/4/alfa/t).
If m = n then alfa = 1 and fi(1) = 3*Zeta'(-1) + log(2*Pi)/4 - 1/6.
For the asymptotic formula for fixed m see A054225.

A002775.name: a(n) = n^2 * n!.
formula: E.g.f.: x*A'(x) where A(x) is the e.g.f. for A001563. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 17 2012

Sum of all matrix elements M(i, j) = i/(i+j) multiplied by 2*n!. a(n) = 2*n! * Sum[Sum[i/(i+j), {i, 1, n}], {j, 1, n}] Example: a(2) = 2*2! * (1/(1+1) + 1/(1+2) + 2/(2+1) + 2/(2+2)) = 8. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Oct 24 2004

A002777.name: Restricted permutations.
formula: a(n) = (n-1)*a(n-1) + 2*(n-d)*a(n-e), where (d, e) = (2, 3) if n even, (1, 2) if n odd.

A002778.name: Numbers whose square is a palindrome.

A002780.name: Numbers whose cube is a palindrome.

A002782.name: Concatenate the natural numbers, then partition into minimal strings so that each term divides the next.

A002785.name: Number of self-complementary oriented graphs with n nodes.
formula: a(2*n) = Sum_{j partition of n & jk=0 if k even} [ Product_{k} 2^(k*jk^2-jk) * Product_{r<t} 2^(2*gcd(r, t)*jr*jt) / Product_{k} k^jk*jk! ]; a(2*n+1) = Sum_{j partition of n & jk=0 if k even} [ Product_{1<=r, t<=n} 2^(gcd(r, t)*jr*jt) / Product_{k} k^jk*jk! ]. - Pab Ter (pabrlos2(AT)yahoo.com), Oct 22 2005

A002786.name: Semigroups of order n with 1 idempotent, considered to be equivalent when they are isomorphic or anti-isomorphic (by reversal of the operator).

A002787.name: Number of semigroups of order n with 2 idempotents, considered to be equivalent when they are isomorphic or anti-isomorphic (by reversal of the operator).

A002788.name: Idempotent semigroups of order n, considered to be equivalent when they are isomorphic or anti-isomorphic (by reversal of the operator).

A002789.name: Number of integer points in a certain quadrilateral scaled by a factor of n.
formula: a(n) = floor( A168668(n+1) / 12), a(n) = A242771(-n), a(n) - a(n-1) = A242774(n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, May 22 2014

A002790.name: Denominators of Cauchy numbers of second type (= Bernoulli numbers B_n^{(n)}).
formula: Denominator of integral of x(x+1)...(x+n-1) from 0 to 1.
E.g.f.: -x/((1-x)*log(1-x)). - Corrected by _Iaroslav V. Blagouchine_, May 07 2016.
Denominator of Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^k A008275(n,k)/(k+1). - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 28 2009
a(n) = denominator(n!*v(n)), where v(n) = 1 - Sum_{i=0..n-1} v(i)/(n-i+1), v(0)=1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 28 2013

A002791.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n, d <= 4} d^2 + 4*Sum_{d|n, d>4} d.
formula: Conjectured: Inverse Moebius transform of g.f.: (x + 2x^2 + 2x^3 + 2x^4 - 3x^4) / (1 - x)^2. - _Sean A. Irvine_, May 16 2014
Conjectured: a(n) = 4 * sigma(n) - f(n mod 6) where f(0) = 10, f(1) = 3, f(2) = 7, f(3) = 6, f(4) = 7, f(5) = 3. - _Sean A. Irvine_, May 17 2014

A002793.name: a(n) = 2n*a(n-1) - (n-1)^2*a(n-2).
formula: Numerators in the sequence of convergents of Stieltjes's continued fraction for A073003, the Euler-Gompertz constant G := int {x = 0..inf} 1/(1+x)*exp(-x) dx:

G = 1/(2 - 1^2/(4 - 2^2/(6 - 3^2/(8 - ...)))). See [Wall, Chapter 18, (92.7) with a = 1]. The sequence of convergents to the continued fraction begins [1/2, 4/7, 20/34, 124/209, ...]. The denominators are in A002720.
G.f.: x = Sum_{n>=1} a(n) * x^n * (1 - (n+1)*x)^2. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 06 2013
a(n) ~ G * exp(2*sqrt(n) - n - 1/2) * n^(n+1/4) / sqrt(2) * (1 + 31/(48*sqrt(n))), where G = 0.596347362323194... is the Gompertz constant (see A073003). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 19 2013

A002794.name: Numerators of convergents to Lehmer's constant.

A002795.name: Denominators of convergents to Lehmer's constant.

A002796.name: Numbers that are divisible by each nonzero digit.

A002797.name: Number of solutions to a linear inequality.

A002799.name: Number of 4-line partitions of n (i.e., planar partitions of n with at most 4 lines).

A002801.name: a(n) = (2*n-1)*a(n-1) - (n-1)*a(n-2) with a(0) = a(1) = 1.
formula: Appears to be the BinomialMean transform of A007696 (see A075271). - _John W. Layman_, Oct 01 2002
a(n) ~ n^(n-1/4) * exp(-n+1/4) * Gamma(3/4) * 2^n / sqrt(Pi). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 08 2013

A002802.name: a(n) = (2*n+3)!/(6*n!*(n+1)!).
formula: Asymptotic expression for a(n) is a(n) ~ (n+2)^(3/2) * 4^(n+2) / (sqrt(Pi) * 48).
a(n) = Sum_{a+b+c+d+e=n} f(a)*f(b)*f(c)*f(d)*f(e) with f(n) = binomial(2n, n) = A000984(n). - _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 22 2004
Also convolution of A000984 with A002697, also convolution of A000302 with A002457.
D-finite with recurrence: n*a(n) - 2*(2*n+3)*a(n-1) = 0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 31 2014
Boas-Buck recurrence: a(n) = (10/n)*Sum_{k=0..n-1} 4^(n-k-1)*a(k), n >= 1, a(0) = 1. Proof from a(n) = A046521(n+2, 2). See a comment there. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Aug 10 2017

A002803.name: a(n) = (2n+4)!/(4!*n!*(n+1)!).
formula: D-finite with recurrence n*(n+1)*a(n) -2*(n+2)*(2*n+3)*a(n-1)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 08 2021

A002804.name: (Presumed) solution to Waring's problem: g(n) = 2^n + floor((3/2)^n) - 2.

A002805.name: Denominators of harmonic numbers H(n) = Sum_{i=1..n} 1/i.
formula: a(n) = n! / gcd(stirling1(n+1, 2), n!) = n! / gcd(A000254(n),n!). - _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 01 2018

A002806.name: Number of ways of getting nothing, a pair, 2 pair, 3 of a kind, other straight, other flush, full house, 4 of a kind, other straight flush, or a royal flush in 5-card poker.

A002807.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=3..n} (k-1)!*C(n,k)/2.
formula: For n>2, a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n-2} A000522(k-1)*A000217(k). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 08 2016

A002808.name: The composite numbers: numbers n of the form x*y for x > 1 and y > 1.
formula: a(n) = pi(a(n)) + 1 + n, where pi is the prime counting function.
Sum_{n>=1} 1/a(n)^s = Zeta(s)-1-P(s), where P is prime zeta. - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Aug 08 2012
n + n/log n + n/log^2 n < a(n) < n + n/log n + 3n/log^2 n for n >= 4, see Panaitopol. Bojarincev gives an asymptotic version. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 23 2012

A002809.name: Increasing values of A000793 (largest order of permutation of n elements).

A002810.name: Smallest number containing n syllables in UK English.
formula: a(n+12) = a(n)*1000+777, as long as a(n+12) is less than one quadrillion (whatever scale is used). - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 03 2013

A002814.name: For n > 1: a(n) = a(n-1)^3 + 3a(n-1)^2 - 3; a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2.
formula: a(n+1) = 5*(f(n))^2 - 3, where f(n) = Fibonacci(3^n) = product of first n entries. - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jun 16 2003
The sequence b(n):= a(n) + 2 is a solution to the recurrence b(n+1) = b(n)^3 - 3*b(n)^2 + 3 with b(1) = 4.
Thus Y := Product_{k = 1..n} a(k) and X := Product_{k = 1..n} (a(k) + 2) give a solution to the Diophantine equation X^2 - 5*Y^2 = -4.
sqrt(5) = Product_{n >= 1} (1 + 2/a(n)). The rate of convergence is cubic. Fine remarks that twelve factors of the product would give well over 300,000 correct decimal digits for sqrt(5).

A002815.name: a(n) = n + Sum_{k=1..n} pi(k), where pi() = A000720.

A002816.name: Number of polygons that can be formed from n points on a circle, no two adjacent.
formula: p(n) = exp(-2)*(1 + O(1/n)). - Aspvall and Liang.

A002817.name: Doubly triangular numbers: a(n) = n*(n+1)*(n^2+n+2)/8.
formula: G.f.: x*(1 + x + x^2)/(1-x)^5. - _Simon Plouffe_ (in his 1992 dissertation); edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 13 2008
a(n) = Sum(Sum(1 + Sum(3*n))). - Xavier Acloque, Jan 21 2003
a(n) = A000332(n+1) + A000332(n+2) + A000332(n+3), with A000332(n) = binomial(n, 4). - _Mitch Harris_, Oct 17 2006 and _Bruce J. Nicholson_, Oct 22 2017
a(n) = Sum_{i=1..C(n,2)} i = C(C(n,2) + 1, 2) = A000217(A000217(n+1)). - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jun 11 2012
Euler transform of length 3 sequence [6, 0, -1]. - _Michael Somos_, Nov 19 2015
a(n) = a(-1-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 17 2017

A002819.name: Liouville's function L(n) = partial sums of A008836.
formula: a(n) = determinant of A174856. - _Mats Granvik_, Mar 31 2010

A002820.name: Number of n X n invertible binary matrices A such that A+I is invertible.

A002822.name: Numbers n such that 6n-1, 6n+1 are twin primes.

A002823.name: Number of period-n solutions to a certain "universal" equation related to transformations on the unit interval.

A002824.name: Number of precomplete Post functions.
formula: a(n) = binomial(n, 2) * A001035(n - 2). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 24 2014

A002825.name: Number of precomplete Post functions.
formula: a(1) = 1. a(n) = -n - 2 + (-1)^(n-1) * Sum_{k=0..n-1} ((-1)^k * binomial(n, k) * Sum_{j=0..k} 2^binomial(k, j)), n > 1. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 24 2014

A002826.name: Number of precomplete Post functions of n variables.

A002827.name: Unitary perfect numbers: usigma(n)-n = n.
formula: If m is a term and omega(m) = A001221(m) = k, then m < 2^(2^k) (Goto, 2007). - _Amiram Eldar_, Jun 06 2020

A002828.name: Least number of squares that add up to n.
formula: a(0) = 0; and for n >= 1, if A010052(n) = 1 [when n is square], a(n) = 1, otherwise, if A229062(n)=1, then a(n) = 2, otherwise a(n) = 3 + A072401(n). [After _Charles R Greathouse IV_'s PARI-program.]
a(0) = 0; for n >= 1, a(n) = 1 + a(n - A262689(n)^2), (see comments).

A002829.name: Number of trivalent (or cubic) labeled graphs with 2n nodes.
formula: E.g.f.: hypergeom([1/6, 5/6],[],12*x/(x^2+8*x+4)^(3/2))*exp(-log(1/4*x^2+2*x+1)/4 - x/3 + (x^2+8*x+4)^(3/2)/(24*x) - 1/(3*x) - x^2/24 - 1). Multiply x^i by (2*i)! to get the generating function. - _Mark van Hoeij_, Nov 07 2011
a(n) ~ sqrt(2) * 6^n * n^(3*n) / exp(3*n+2). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 11 2014

A002830.name: Number of 3-edge-colored trivalent graphs with 2n nodes.
formula: G.f.: exp(sum(F(x^k) / k, k >= 1) where F(x) is the g.f. for A002831. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Sep 09 2014

A002831.name: Number of 3-edge-colored connected trivalent graphs with 2n nodes.
formula: G.f.: sum(mobius(k) * log(G(x^k)) / k, k >= 1) where G(x) is the g.f. for A002830. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Sep 09 2014
Asymptotics: a(n) ~ (2/Pi)^(1/2)*(2/e)^n*n^{n - 1/2}; cf. Ciobanu and Kolpakov in Links. - _Sasha Kolpakov_, Dec 17 2017

A002832.name: Median Euler numbers.
formula: G.f.: -1/G(0) where G(k)= x*(8*k^2+8*k+3) - 1 - (4*k+5)*(4*k+3)*(k+1)^2*x^2/G(k+1); (continued fraction, 1-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 08 2012

A002834.name: Number of ways of getting a straight flush, 4 of a kind, full house, flush, straight, 3 of a kind, 2 pair, a pair, nothing in a 3-card poker hand.

A002835.name: Solid partitions of n which are restricted to two planes.

A002836.name: Let F(x) = 1 + x + 4x^2 + 10x^3 + ... = g.f. for A000293 (solid partitions) and expand (1-x)(1-x^2)(1-x^3)...*F(x) in powers of x.

A002837.name: Numbers k such that k^2 - k + 41 is prime.

A002838.name: Balancing weights on the integer line.
formula: a(n) = A047997(n, n) = A067059(n, n+1). a(n) tends towards (sqrt(12)/Pi)*4^n/n^2 and something like (sqrt(12)/Pi)*4^n/(n^2+1.85*n+0.8) seems to give an even closer approximation. - _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 09 2002

A002839.name: Number of simple perfect squared rectangles of order n up to symmetry.
formula: In 'A Census of Planar Maps', William Tutte gave an asymptotic formula for the number of perfect squared rectangles where n is the number of elements in the dissection (the order);
a(n) = A006983(n) + A219766(n). - _Stuart E Anderson_, Dec 07 2012

A002840.name: Number of polyhedral graphs with n edges.

A002841.name: Number of 3-connected self-dual planar graphs with 2n edges.

A002842.name: Number of strongly asymmetric sequences of length n.

A002843.name: Number of partitions of n into parts 1/2, 3/4, 7/8, 15/16, etc.
formula: Row sums of A049286 and A047913. [_Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 02 2009]

A002844.name: Number of non-isentropic binary rooted trees with n nodes.

A002845.name: Number of distinct values taken by 2^2^...^2 (with n 2's and parentheses inserted in all possible ways).

A002846.name: Number of ways of transforming a set of n indistinguishable objects into n singletons via a sequence of n-1 refinements.

A002847.name: Number of ways of getting a straight flush, 4 of a kind, full house, flush, straight, 3 of a kind, 2 pair, a pair, no pair in poker.

A002848.name: Maximal number of disjoint subsets {X,Y,Z} of {1, 2, ..., n} with X + Y = Z (as in A002849), with the property that n is in one of the subsets.
formula: a(n) = A002849(n) for n == 0,3,7,10 (mod 12), 0 for n=1, and A002849(n) - A002849(n-1) otherwise. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_

A002849.name: Maximal number of disjoint subsets {X,Y,Z} of {1, 2, ..., n}, each satisfying X + Y = Z.

A002850.name: Number of decompositions of 2n into sum of 2 lucky numbers.

A002851.name: Number of unlabeled trivalent (or cubic) connected graphs with 2n nodes.

A002852.name: Continued fraction for Euler's constant (or Euler-Mascheroni constant) gamma.

A002853.name: Maximal size of a set of equiangular lines in n dimensions.

A002854.name: Number of unlabeled Euler graphs with n nodes; number of unlabeled two-graphs with n nodes; number of unlabeled switching classes of graphs with n nodes; number of switching classes of unlabeled signed complete graphs on n nodes; number of Seidel matrices of order n.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{s} 2^M(s)/Product_{i} i^s(i)*s(i)!, where the sum is over n-tuples s in [0..n]^n such that n = Sum i*s(i), M(s) = Sum_{i<j} s(i)*s(j)*gcd(i,j) + Sum_{i} (s(i)*(floor(i/2) - 1) + i*binomial(s(i),2)) + sign(Sum_{k} s(2*k+1)). [Robinson's formula, from Mallows & Sloane, simplified.] - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 15 2012; corrected by _Sean A. Irvine_, Nov 05 2014

A002856.name: Number of polyhedra with n nodes and n faces.

A002857.name: Number of Post functions of n variables.

A002858.name: Ulam numbers: a(1) = 1; a(2) = 2; for n>2, a(n) = least number > a(n-1) which is a unique sum of two distinct earlier terms.

A002859.name: a(1) = 1, a(2) = 3; for n >= 3, a(n) is smallest number that is uniquely of the form a(j) + a(k) with 1 <= j < k < n.

A002860.name: Number of Latin squares of order n; or labeled quasigroups.

A002861.name: Number of connected functions (or mapping patterns) on n unlabeled points, or number of rings and branches with n edges.

A002862.name: Number of nonisomorphic connected functions with no fixed points, or proper rings with n edges.

A002863.name: Number of prime knots with n crossings.

A002864.name: Number of alternating prime knots with n crossings.

A002865.name: Number of partitions of n that do not contain 1 as a part.
formula: a(0)=1, a(n) = p(n)-p(n-1), n>=1, with the partition numbers p(n) := A000041(n).
a(n) = A085811(n+3). - _James A. Sellers_, Dec 06 2005 [Corrected by _Gionata Neri_, Jun 14 2015]
a(n) = Sum(A008284(n-k+1,k-1): 1<k<=floor((n+2)/2) for n>0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 04 2007
G.f.: 1 + sum(n>=2, x^n / prod(k>=n, 1-x^k)). - _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 13 2011
G.f.: sum(n>=0, x^(2*n) / prod(k=1..n, 1-x^k ) ). - _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 17 2011
a(n) = A090824(n,1) for n > 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 10 2012
More generally, A(q) = Sum_{n >= 0} q^(n*(n+r))/( (1 - q) * Product_{k = 2..n} (1 - q^k)^2  * Product_{i = 1..r} (1 - q^(n+i)) ) for r = 0,1,2,.... (End)

A002866.name: a(0) = 1; for n > 0, a(n) = 2^(n-1)*n!.
formula: E.g.f.: (1 - x)/(1 - 2*x). - _Paul Barry_, May 26 2003, corrected Jun 18 2007
For n >= 1, a(n) = Sum_{i=0..m/2} (-1)^i * binomial(n, i) * (n-2*i)^n. - Yong Kong (ykong(AT)curagen.com), Dec 28 2000
E.g.f. is B(A(x)), where B(x) = 1/(1 - x) and A(x) = x/(1 - x). - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Mar 16 2009
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} A156992(n,k). - _Dennis P. Walsh_, Nov 26 2011
a(n+1) = Sum_{k=0..n} A132393(n,k)*2^(n+k), n>0. - _Philippe Deléham_, Nov 28 2011
a(n) = 2*n*a(n-1) for n >= 2. - _Dennis P. Walsh_, Nov 29 2011
G.f.: (1 + 1/G(0))/2,  where G(k)=  1 + 2*x*k - 2*x*(k + 1)/G(k+1); (continued fraction, Euler's 1st kind, 1-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 02 2012
G.f.: 1 + x/Q(0), m=4, where Q(k) = 1 - m*x*(2*k + 1) - m*x^2*(2*k + 1)*(2*k + 2)/(1 - m*x*(2*k + 2) - m*x^2*(2*k + 2)*(2*k + 3)/Q(k+1)) ; (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 23 2013
G.f.: 1 + x/(G(0) - x), where G(k) = 1 + x*(k+1) - 4*x*(k + 1)/(1 - x*(k + 2)/G(k+1)); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 24 2013
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} L(n,k)*k!; L(n,k) are the unsigned Lah numbers. - _Peter Luschny_, Oct 18 2014
a(n) = round(Sum_{k >= 1} log(k)^n/k^(3/2))/4,  for n >= 1, which is related to the n-th derivative of zeta(x) evaluated at x = 3/2. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Jan 02 2015
a(n) = n!*hypergeom([-n+1], [], -1)) for n>=1. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 08 2015

A002868.name: Largest number in n-th row of triangle of Lah numbers (A008297 and A271703).
formula: For 2 <= n <= 7, equals (n+1)!*n/2. - _Alexander R. Povolotsky_, Oct 16 2006

A002869.name: Largest number in n-th row of triangle A019538.

A002870.name: Largest Stirling numbers of second kind: a(n) = max_{k=1..n} S2(n,k).

A002871.name: a(n) = max_{k=0..n} 2^k*A048993(n,k)
formula: a(n) = max{2^k*stirling2(n,k), k=0..n}. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Mar 26 2013

A002872.name: Number of partitions of {1..2n} that are invariant under a permutation consisting of n 2-cycles.
formula: a(n) = A080107(2n) for all n. - _Jörgen Backelin_, Jan 13 2016
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} Stirling2(n, k)*A005425(k). (from Knuth reference) - _Robert A. Russell_, Apr 28 2018

A002873.name: The maximal number of partitions of {1..2n} that are invariant under a permutation consisting of n 2-cycles, and which have the same number of nonempty parts.

A002874.name: The number of partitions of {1..3n} that are invariant under a permutation consisting of n 3-cycles.

A002875.name: Sorting numbers (see Motzkin article for details).

A002876.name: Number of weighted linear spaces of total weight n.

A002877.name: Number of connected weighted linear spaces of total weight n.

A002878.name: Bisection of Lucas sequence: a(n) = L(2*n+1).
formula: a(n) = S(2*n, sqrt(5)) = S(n, 3)+S(n-1, 3); S(n, x) := U(n, x/2), Chebyshev polynomials of 2nd kind, A049310. S(n, 3)= A001906(n+1) (even indexed Fibonacci numbers).
a(n) = phi^(2*n+1)-phi^(-2*n-1), n >= 0. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Jan 03 2011
Let q(n, x) = Sum_{i=0..n} x^(n-i)*binomial(2*n-i, i); then (-1)^n*q(n, -1) = a(n). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 10 2002
a(n) = 2^(-n)*A082762(n) = 4^(-n)*Sum_{k>=0} binomial(2*n+1, 2*k)*5^k; see A091042. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 01 2004
Both bisection and binomial transform of A000204.
a(n) = the numerators of sinh((2*n-1)*psi) where the denominators are 2. Psi=log((1+sqrt5)/2). Offset 1. a(3)=11. - Al Hakanson (hawkuu(AT)gmail.com), Mar 25 2009
a(n) = floor(phi^(2n+1)), where phi is the golden ratio, A001622. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jun 10 2012
a(n) = lim_{m->infinity} Fibonacci(m)^(4n+1)*Fibonacci(m+2*n+1)/ Sum_{k=0..m} Fibonacci(k)^(4n+2). - _Yalcin Aktar_, Sep 02 2014

The aerated sequence (b(n))n>=1 = [1, 0, 4, 0, 11, 0, 29, 0, ...] is a fourth-order linear divisibility sequence; that is, if n | m then b(n) | b(m). It is the case P1 = 0, P2 = -1, Q = -1 of the 3-parameter family of divisibility sequences found by Williams and Guy.
b(n) = (1/2)*((-1)^n - 1)*F(n) + (1 + (-1)^(n-1))*F(n+1), where F(n) is a Fibonacci number. The o.g.f. is x*(1 + x^2)/(1 - 3*x^2 + x^4).
a(n) = sqrt(5*F(2*n+1)^2-4), where F(n) = A000045(n). - _Derek Orr_, Jun 18 2015
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^floor(k/2)*binomial(n-floor((k+1)/2), floor(k/2))*3^(n-k). - _L. Edson Jeffery_, Feb 26 2018
a(n)*F(m+2n-1) = F(m+4n-2)-F(m), with Fibonacci number F(m), empirical observation. - _Dan Weisz_, Jul 30, 2018
a(n) = -a(-1-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 31 2018

A002879.name: Number of ways of getting a straight flush, 4 of a kind, full house, flush, straight, 3 of a kind, 2 pair, a pair, nothing in a 7-card poker hand.

A002880.name: Number of 3-connected nets with n edges.

A002881.name: Number of simple imperfect squared rectangles of order n up to symmetry.

A002882.name: Nearest integer to Bernoulli number B_{2n}.
formula: Asymptotic expansion of 1/(2x^2) + Sum_{k>0} 1/(x + k)^2 - 1/(6(x^3 - x)) + Sum_{p>3 prime} 1/(p(x^p - x)) = Sum_{k>=0} a(k)/x^(2k + 1). From Ramanujan.

A002883.name: Number of allomorphic polyhedra with n nodes.

A002884.name: Number of nonsingular n X n matrices over GF(2); order of Chevalley group A_n (2); order of projective special linear group PSL_n(2).

A002885.name: Number of cyclic Steiner triple systems of order 2n+1.

A002887.name: The minimum number of nodes of a tree with a cutting center of n nodes.

A002888.name: a(n) is the cutting number of the tree corresponding to A002887(n).

A002890.name: Low temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising free energy on 2D square lattice.

A002891.name: Low temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising free energy on 3-dimensional simple cubic lattice.

A002893.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n,k)^2 * binomial(2*k,k).
formula: D-finite with recurrence: (n+1)^2 a(n+1) = (10*n^2+10*n+3) * a(n) - 9*n^2 * a(n-1). - _Matthijs Coster_, Apr 28 2004
a(n) = Sum_{p+q+r=n} (n!/(p!*q!*r!))^2 with p, q, r >= 0. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 25 2007
G.f. y=A(x) satisfies: 0 = x*(x - 1)*(9*x - 1)*y'' + (27*x^2 - 20*x + 1)*y' + 3*(3*x - 1)*y. - _Gheorghe Coserea_, Jul 01 2018

A002894.name: a(n) = binomial(2n, n)^2.
formula: G.f.: F(1/2, 1/2; 1; 16*x) = 1 / AGM(1, (1 - 16*x)^(1/2)) = K(4*sqrt(x)) / (Pi/2), where AGM(x, y) is the arithmetic-geometric mean of Gauss and Legendre. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 04 2003
G.f.: 2*EllipticK(4*sqrt(x))/Pi, using Maple's convention for elliptic integrals.

Integral representation as the n-th moment of a positive function W(x) on (0,16), in Maple notation, W(x)=EllipticK(sqrt(1-x/16)/(2*Pi^2*sqrt(x)); a(n)=int(x^n* W(x), x=0..16), n>=0. The function W(x) is singular at x=0 and W(16)=1/(16*Pi). This representation is unique since W(x) is the solution of the Hausdorff moment problem. - Stanley Smith and _Karol A. Penson_, Jun 19 2015

a(n) = binomial(2*n,n)*binomial(2*n,n) = ( [x^n](1 + x)^(2*n) ) *( [x^n](1 + x)^(2*n) ) = [x^n](F(x)^(4*n)), where F(x) = 1 + x + x^2 + 4*x^3 + 20*x^4 + 120*x^5 + 798*x^6 + 5697*x^7 + ... appears to have integer coefficients. For similar results see A000897, A002897, A006480, A008977, A186420 and A188662. - _Peter Bala_, Jul 14 2016
a(n) = Sum_{k = 0..n} binomial(2*n + k,k)*binomial(n,k)^2. Cf. A005258(n) = Sum_{k = 0..n} binomial(n + k,k)*binomial(n,k)^2. - _Peter Bala_, Jul 27 2016
The right-hand side of the binomial coefficient identity Sum_{k = 0..n} C(n,k)*C(n+k,k)*C(2*n+2*k,n+k)*(-4)^(n-k) = a(n). - _Peter Bala_, Mar 16 2018

A002895.name: Domb numbers: number of 2n-step polygons on diamond lattice.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n, k)^2 * binomial(2n-2k, n-k) * binomial(2k, k).
D-finite with recurrence: n^3*a(n) = 2*(2*n-1)*(5*n^2-5*n+2)*a(n-1) - 64*(n-1)^3*a(n-2). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 16 2004
Via the Zeilberger algorithm, _Zhi-Wei Sun_ proved that:
a(n) = Sum_{p+q+r+s=n} (n!/(p!*q!*r!*s!))^2 with p,q,r,s >= 0. See Verrill, p. 5. - _Peter Bala_, Jan 06 2020

A002896.name: Number of 2n-step polygons on cubic lattice.
formula: E.g.f.: Sum_[n>=0, a(n)*x^(2*n)/(2*n)!] = BesselI(0, 2*x)^3. - Corrected by _Christopher J. Smyth_, Oct 29 2012
D-finite with recurrence: n^3*a(n) = 2*(2*n-1)*(10*n^2-10*n+3)*a(n-1)-36*(n-1)*(2*n-1)*(2*n-3)*a(n-2). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 16 2004

An asymptotic formula follows immediately from an observation of Bruce Richmond and myself in SIAM Review - 31 (1989, 122-125. We use Hayman's method to find the asymptotic behavior of the sum of squares of the multinomial coefficients multi(n, k_1, k_2, ...,k_m) with m fixed. From this one gets a_n ~ (3 sqrt(3)/4)*{6^{2*n}}/{(Pi*n)^{3/2}}. - Cecil C Rousseau (ccrousse(AT)memphis.edu), Mar 14 2006
PSUM transform is A174516. - _Michael Somos_, May 21 2013
a(n) = [(x y z)^0] (x+1/x+y+1/y+z+1/z)^(2*n). - _Christopher J. Smyth_, Sep 25 2018

A002897.name: a(n) = binomial(2n,n)^3.
formula: Expansion of (K(k)/(Pi/2))^2 in powers of (kk'/4)^2, where K(k) is the complete elliptic integral of the first kind evaluated at modulus k. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 31 2007
G.f.: F(1/2, 1/2, 1/2; 1, 1; 64x) where F() is a hypergeometric function. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 31 2007
D-finite with recurrence n^3*a(n) - 8*(2*n - 1)^3*a(n-1) = 0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 08 2013

a(n) = binomial(2*n,n)^3 = ( [x^n](1 + x)^(2*n) )^3 = [x^n](F(x)^(8*n)), where F(x) = 1 + x + 6*x^2 + 111*x^3 + 2806*x^4 + 84456*x^5 + 2832589*x^6 + 102290342*x^7 + ... appears to have integer coefficients. For similar results see A000897, A002894, A006480, A008977, A186420 and A188662. (End)

A002898.name: Number of n-step closed paths on hexagonal lattice.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i=0..n} (-2)^(n-i)*binomial(n, i)*(Sum_{j=0..i} binomial(i, j)^3). - Vasu Tewari (vasu(AT)math.ubc.ca), Aug 04 2010

A002899.name: Number of n-step polygons on f.c.c. lattice.

A002900.name: Number of n-step walks on square lattice.

A002902.name: Number of n-step self-avoiding walks on a cubic lattice with a first step along the positive x, y, or z axis.

A002903.name: Number of n-step self-avoiding walks on b.c.c. lattice.
formula: Apparently a(n) = A001666(n-1)/2 for n > 1. - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Dec 29 2018

A002904.name: Delete all letters except c, d, i, l, m, v, x from the English name of n, then read as Roman numeral if possible, otherwise 0.

A002905.name: Number of connected graphs with n edges.
formula: A000664 and this sequence are an Euler transform pair. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 30 2016

A002906.name: High temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising magnetic susceptibility on 2D square lattice.

A002907.name: High temperature series in v = tanh(J/kT) for residual correlation function (correction to susceptibility) for the spin-1/2 Ising model on square lattice.
formula: G.f.: ((1-3*v)^2*xi(v) - (1-v)^2 + 2*v*u(v)) / (8*v^7*(1+v)^2), where xi(v) is the g.f. of A002906 and u(v) is the g.f. of A002908 (odd powers only!); the actual "residual correlation function" is the numerator of this expression [Sykes & Fisher]. - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Feb 28 2021

A002908.name: High temperature expansion of -u/J in odd powers of v = tanh(J/kT), where u is energy per site of the spin-1/2 Ising model on square lattice with nearest-neighbor interaction J at temperature T.

A002909.name: Low temperature energy function for square lattice.

A002910.name: High-temperature series in v = tanh(J/kT) for susceptibility for the Ising model on honeycomb structure.

A002912.name: Low-temperature series in z = exp(-2J/kT) for ferromagnetic susceptibility for the Ising model on honeycomb structure.

A002913.name: High temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising magnetic susceptibility on 3-dimensional simple cubic lattice.

A002915.name: Low temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising antiferromagnetic susceptibility for 3-dimensional simple cubic lattice.

A002916.name: High temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising specific heat on 3-dimensional simple cubic lattice.

A002917.name: High temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising specific heat on 3-dimensional b.c.c. lattice.

A002918.name: High temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising specific heat on 3-dimensional f.c.c. lattice.

A002919.name: High-temperature series for susceptibility for the spin-1/2 Ising model on hexagonal lattice.
formula: a(n) = A002910(2*n), cf. A002920. - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Mar 01 2021

A002920.name: High-temperature series in w = tanh(J/kT) for ferromagnetic susceptibility for the spin-1/2 Ising model on hexagonal lattice.
formula: G.f.: (h(v(w)) + h(-v(w))) / 2, where h(v) is the g.f. of A002910 and v(w)^2 = w*(1+w)/(1+w^3) [Fisher, p. 979]. - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Mar 01 2021

A002924.name: Ferromagnetic susceptibility series for f.c.c. lattice.

A002926.name: Low temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising magnetic susceptibility on 3-dimensional simple cubic lattice.

A002927.name: Low temperature series for spin-1/2 Ising magnetic susceptibility on 2D square lattice.

A002931.name: Number of self-avoiding polygons of length 2n on square lattice (not allowing rotations).

A002935.name: Number of series-reduced star graphs with n edges.

A002936.name: Solid partitions of n, distinct along rows.

A002937.name: An exotic continued fraction (for the real root of x^3 - 8*x - 10).

A002938.name: The minimal sequence (from solving n^3 - m^2 = a(n)).

A002939.name: a(n) = 2*n*(2*n-1).
formula: Product_{k=1..n} a(k) = (2n)! = A010050(n). - _Tony Foster III_, Sep 06 2015
a(n) = A002943(-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 28 2017
0 = 12 + a(n)*(-8 + a(n) - 2*a(n+1)) + a(n+1)*(-8 + a(n+1)) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 28 2017

A002940.name: Arrays of dumbbells.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} ( Sum_{i=0..n} k*C(k, i-k) ). - _Paul Barry_, Feb 16 2005

A002943.name: a(n) = 2*n*(2*n+1).
formula: a(n) = A007494(n) + A173511(n) = A007742(n) + n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 20 2010

A002944.name: a(n) = LCM(1,2,...,n) / n.
formula: a(n) = LCM of C(n-1, 0), C(n-1, 1), ..., C(n-1, n-1). [Montgomery-Breusch] [Corrected by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 11 2008]
Equally, a(n+1) = LCM_{k=0..n} binomial(n,k). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jul 05 2009

A002945.name: Continued fraction for cube root of 2.
formula: Bombieri/van der Poorten give a complicated formula:

A002946.name: Continued fraction for cube root of 3.

A002947.name: Continued fraction for cube root of 4.

A002948.name: Continued fraction for cube root of 5.

A002949.name: Continued fraction for cube root of 6.

A002950.name: Continued fraction for fifth root of 2.

A002951.name: Continued fraction for fifth root of 5.

A002954.name: Smallest number such that n-th iterate of Chowla function is 0.

A002955.name: Number of (unordered, unlabeled) rooted trimmed trees with n nodes.
formula: a(n) satisfies a=SHIFT_RIGHT(EULER(a-b)) where b(2)=1, b(k)=0 if k != 2.

A002956.name: Number of basic invariants for cyclic group of order and degree n.

A002957.name: Numbers n such that 2*10^n - 1 is prime.

A002958.name: Numbers n such that 2*25^n - 1 is prime.

A002959.name: Numbers n such that 2*7^n - 1 is prime.

A002960.name: The square sieve.
formula: Conjecture: a(n) = a(n-1) + 1 + floor(sqrt(a(n-1) + 1 + floor(sqrt(a(n-1))))); a(1) = 2. - _Gionata Neri_, Jun 22 2015
Conjecture: a(n) = 2^(x-1)*(2^(x-1)+y-1) + floor((y+1)^2/4), where y = n+1+x-2^x and x = floor(log_2(n+1+floor(log_2(n)))). - _Gionata Neri_, Jul 05 2015

A002961.name: Numbers k such that k and k+1 have same sum of divisors.
formula: Sum_{n>=1} 1/a(n) is in the interval (0.080958, 610837) (Bayless and Kinlaw, 2015). - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 15 2020

A002962.name: Number of simple imperfect squared squares of order n up to symmetry.

A002963.name: Chisel strokes required for Roman numerals for n.

A002964.name: Smallest number requiring n chisel strokes for its representation in Roman numerals.

A002965.name: Interleave denominators (A000129) and numerators (A001333) of convergents to sqrt(2).
formula: a(0)=0, a(1)=1, a(n) = a(n-1) + a(2*[(n-2)/2]). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jan 31 2006
a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-2-(n mod 2)); a(0)=0, a(1)=1. - _Ctibor O. Zizka_, Oct 28 2018

A002966.name: Egyptian fractions: number of solutions of 1 = 1/x_1 + ... + 1/x_n where 0 < x_1 <= ... <= x_n.

A002967.name: Egyptian fractions: number of solutions of 1 = 1/x_1 + ... + 1/x_n in positive integers.

A002968.name: Number of pairings {(b[1],c[1]),(b[2],c[2]),...,(b[n],c[n])} of the first 2n positive integers satisfying b[i] < c[i] and such that the 2n numbers c[i]+b[i] and c[i]-b[i] are all distinct.

A002969.name: E.g.f. 1/(1 - sin(x) + sin(x)^2).
formula: a(n) = 2*sum(m=1..n, sum(j=0..(n-m)/2, (binomial(m,n-m-2*j)*sum(i=0..(n-2*j)/2, (2*i+2*j-n)^n*binomial(n-2*j,i)*(-1)^(m-j-i)))/2^(n-2*j))), n>0, a(0)=1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Jun 08 2011

A002970.name: Numbers n such that 4*n^2 + 9 is prime.

A002971.name: Numbers k such that 4*k^2 + 25 is prime.

A002972.name: a(n) is the odd member of {x,y}, where x^2+y^2 is the n-th prime of the form 4i+1.
formula: a(n) = MIN(A173330(n), A002144(n) - A173330(n)). [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 16 2010]

A002973.name: a(n) is half of the even member of {x,y}, where x^2+y^2 is the n-th prime of the form 4i+1.
formula: a(n) = MIN(A173331(n), A002144(n) - A173331(n)) / 2. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 16 2010]

A002974.name: Number of restricted solid partitions of n.

A002975.name: Primitive weird numbers: weird numbers with no proper weird divisors.

A002976.name: Number of certain self-avoiding walks with n steps on square lattice (see reference for precise definition).

A002977.name: Klarner-Rado sequence: a(1) = 1; subsequent terms are defined by the rule that if m is present so are 2m+1 and 3m+1.
formula: It seems that limit as n->infinity of log(A002977(n))/log(n) = C = 1.3.. and probably A002977(n) is asymptotic to u*n^C with u=1.0... - _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 06 2002
Limit as n->infinity of log(A002977(n))/log(n) = C = 1.269220905243564855888589424556..., and limit as n->infinity of A002977(n)/n^C = u = 1.335... - _Yi Yang_, Jul 23 2011, Aug 21 2017

A002978.name: Low-temperature series in y = exp(2J/kT) for antiferromagnetic susceptibility for the Ising model on honeycomb structure.
formula: G.f.: 8*t(u(y)) - 4*h(y), where t(u) is the g.f. of A047709, h(y) is the g.f. of A002912, and u(y) = y/(1-y+y^2) [Sykes & Fisher, p. 934-935]. (End)

A002979.name: Low-temperature series in exp(4J/kT) for antiferromagnetic susceptibility for the Ising model on square lattice.

A002981.name: Numbers k such that k! + 1 is prime.

A002982.name: Numbers n such that n! - 1 is prime.

A002984.name: a(0) = 1; for n > 0, a(n) = a(n-1) + floor(sqrt(a(n-1))).

A002985.name: Number of trees in an n-node wheel.

A002986.name: Number of non-cyclic hydrocarbons with n carbon atoms (excluding stereoisomers).

A002987.name: a(1) = 1; a(2) = 2; a(n) == a(k) (mod n-k) for all 1 < k < n.

A002988.name: Trimmed trees with n nodes.
formula: G.f.: 1+B(x)+(B(x^2)-B(x)^2)/2 where B(x) is g.f. of A002955.

A002989.name: Number of n-node trees with a forbidden limb of length 3.
formula: G.f.: 1+B(x)+(B(x^2)-B(x)^2)/2 where B(x) is g.f. of A052321.

A002990.name: Number of n-node trees with a forbidden limb of length 4.
formula: G.f.: 1+B(x)+(B(x^2)-B(x)^2)/2 where B(x) is g.f. of A052327.

A002991.name: Number of n-node trees with a forbidden limb of length 5.
formula: G.f.: 1+B(x)+(B(x^2)-B(x)^2)/2 where B(x) is g.f. of A052328. - _Christian G. Bower_, Dec 15 1999

A002992.name: Number of n-node trees with a forbidden limb of length 6.
formula: G.f.: 1+B(x)+(B(x^2)-B(x)^2)/2 where B(x) is g.f. of A052329.

A002995.name: Number of unlabeled planar trees (also called plane trees) with n nodes.
formula: G.f.: 1+B(x)+(C(x^2)-C(x)^2)/2 where B is g.f. of A003239 and C is g.f. of A000108(n-1).

A002996.name: a(n) = Sum_{k|n} mu(k)*Catalan(n/k) (mu = Moebius function A008683).

A002997.name: Carmichael numbers: composite numbers n such that a^(n-1) == 1 (mod n) for every a coprime to n.
formula: Sum_{n>=1} 1/a(n) is in the interval (0.004706, 27.8724) (Bayless and Kinlaw, 2017). - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 26 2020

A002998.name: Smallest multiple of n whose digits sum to n.

A003000.name: Number of bifix-free (or primary, or unbordered) words of length n over a two-letter alphabet.
formula: G.f. g(x) satisfies (1-2*x)*g(x) = 2 - g(x^2). - _Robert Israel_, Jan 12 2015
